intro: Leobordea sphaerosperma, commonly known as the spherical-seeded leobordea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by succulent leaves and flowers adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, spherical seeds that are often dispersed by wind, aiding in its survival in dry conditions. Its structure includes fleshy, ribbed stems and leaves that reduce water loss. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats.
